results.title: The Pilgrims
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A recreation of the events leading to the settlement of the first English colony in New England. Shows the hardships of the first winter on Cape Cod, the problems of government as solved by the Mayflower Compact, the relationship between the settlers and the native Americans, and the celebration of the first Thanksgiving.
results.description: A recreation of the events leading to the settlement of the first English colony in New England. results.title: Pictures of France: Roussillon
results.creator_credit: Max Sautet and French Government Tourist Office
results.brief_description: A rugged landscape compounded of vineyards, rocks and mountains forms the province of Rousillon. At Perpignon, carnival festivities with dancing, masks and fireworks, culminate in a solemn Easter procession through the streets. Traces of various cultural influences remain today in the colour of the bullring and the quaint abbey town with rock-hewn walls and narrow streets. This rich variety of life and architecture makes a painters’ paradise, as ancient traditions are kept alive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Max Sautet and French Government Tourist Office

results.title: Picasso (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Flanagan, Michael Redington and Associated Television
results.brief_description: Sir Kenneth Clark introduces paintings by the Spanish painter Pable Picasso. Filmed in the Tate Gallery, London, where the paintings are displayed in chronological order, we see how, as he matured, his approach changed. From 30 selected paintings, Sir Kenneth shows Picasso’s earliest work, while still in his teens, through various impressionistic works and the great era of his murals to his present works.

results.title: Photons
results.creator_credit: Wallace Worsley, Stephen White and Physical Science Study Committee
results.brief_description: John King demonstrates particular like behaviours of light, using a photomultiplier and oscilloscope output to observe a weak intermittent light source.

results.title: Photography: the incisive art
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, Robert Katz and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Ansel Adams, American photographer, has achieved a rare degree of harmony between the work for his clients in commerce and industry, his own deep interest in nature and conservation, and his task of making photographs that are works of art. As an introduction to professional photography, for both the novice and the non-photographer, the film presents many original ideas, and gives a high goal to aim for.

results.title: The Philippines: the furthest cross
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray, John Temple, Roan Hannam, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of the Philippines. A well-photographed and interesting documentary. Photography by Dean Semler. Unit Manager Damien Parer.

results.title: Peter Ustinov's Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Presents Peter Ustinov’s personal view of Leningrad. He briefly relates the city’s history, showing many of the buildings - St. Peter and St. Paul Cathedral, the Imperial Winter Palace, St. Isaac’s Cathedral, amongst many others. He discusses many aspects of the arts, literature, music ballet and drama of Leningrad.

results.title: Peter O'toole on Lawrence of Arabia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monitor”.
On location in Spain Peter O’Toole, the star of Lawrence of Arabia, talks to Kenneth Griffiths about his approach to the role of Lawrence. Actual scenes of the shooting of the film around Almeria in Spain are shown.
